en.title: Workshop Application
en.description: Please provide us with basic information about you. Select your workshops, and tell us how these workshops will be helpful for your education/career.

en.title: SELECT THE WORKSHOPS YOU WOULD LIKE TO APPLY TO
Review your submission
en.description: Please review your application one last time and ensure that all email addresses are correct. If we don't have correct email addresses, we will not be able to send important correspondence regarding your application.

en.title: Review Workshop Application
en.description: Please review the responses provided by the applicant in the workshop application below.

en.title: Reference Questionnaire
en.description:
Please complete the following reference form to help the applicant complete the application process.

Note: your answers will be kept private and will not be shared with the applicant.
To be eligible for registration and travel awards, reference forms need to be received before the early application deadline of April 12, 2019

en.title: Review your submission
en.description: Please review your reference submission to ensure that all the information provided is accurate.

en.title: In no more than 3 sentences, describe your research project and how attendance in this workshop(s) would assist in this project (e.g. breast cancer data sets, 50 tumors, NGS sequencing, Cancer Genomics workshop will help me determine an analysis pipeline):
List the bioinformatics software and databases you have used that are relevant to the course(s) you are applying for
In no more than 3 sentences, what are your personal expectations? What kind of things would you like to be able to do at the end of the workshop?
Have you previously participated in a bioinformatics.ca workshop?
If yes, please list which workshops you have attended:
Are you currently a graduate student, post doctoral fellow or clinical fellow?

en.description: Gender information will be used for workshop statistics only and will not influence acceptance into the workshop
en.title: Gender
Will you be applying for a registration award?
The registration awards will cover the registration fee for two (2) participant's for each workshop (2-day workshop: $475+TAX; or 2.5-day workshop: $575+TAX; or 3-day workshops: $700+TAX).
The travel award will cover the travel and accomodation fees for attendance at a workshop (some restrictions apply). Registration fees will be the responsibility of the participant.
How will bioinformatics.ca workshops you have applied for benefit both your project and your skills?
How will the skills gained in the bioinformatics.ca workshops you have applied for benefit your career?
How will bioinformatics.ca workshops you have applied for benefit both your project and your skills?
How will the skills gained in the bioinformatics.ca workshops you have applied for benefit your career?
Will you be applying for the travel award to attend these workshops?
Eligibility Criteria
en.markdown:
• Must be a graduate student, post-doctoral fellow or clinical fellow
  • Must be attending a Canadian university, college, teaching hospital or not-for-profit research institution
Note: Only one of the registration award or travel award will be awarded to any one applicant, not both awards, so please choose the most appropriate award to your situation.

en.title: Within this workshop class, do you permit CBW to circulate your name and email address to the other workshop participants as part of a workshop contact list?
Do you allow CBW to take and post group photos that could include you for promoting the workshops

The CBW is working to reduce its environmental footprint. You can help us by opting to access online versions of workshop lecture notes and tutorials instead of receiving a binder of printed materials. At the workshop, do you want a binder of printed lecture notes (in addition to online access to PDF versions)?
en.description:
Select YES if you want a binder containing the lectures in print along with online access to PDF versions.
Select NO if you want only online access to PDF versions of lectures.

en.title: Do you wish to opt in to being added to the Bioinformatics.ca alumni mailing list? The mailing list is used by Bioinformatics.ca to announce upcoming workshops, and you can unsubscribe from the mailing list at anytime:

en.markdown:
Canadian Bioinformatics Workshops is dedicated to providing a harassment-free learning experience for everyone, regardless of gender, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, nationality, religion, or choice of text editor. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form.  
  
Harassment includes offensive verbal comments related to gender, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, religion, sexual images in public spaces, deliberate intimidation, stalking, following, harassing photography or recording, sustained disruption of talks or other events, inappropriate physical contact, and unwelcome sexual attention.  
  
All communication should be appropriate for a professional audience including people of many different backgrounds. Sexual language and imagery is not appropriate for any event.  
  
Be kind to others. Do not insult or put down other attendees.  
  
Behave professionally. Remember that harassment and sexist, racist, or exclusionary jokes are not appropriate.  
  
Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately. Attendees violating these rules may be asked to leave the event at the sole discretion of the conference organizers without a refund of any charge that may have been levied.  
  
Thank you for helping make this a welcoming, friendly event for all.  
  
This code of conduct is a modified version of that used by Software Carpentry, which uses a modified version of the code used by PyCon, which in turn is forked from a template written by the Ada Initiative and hosted on the Geek Feminism Wiki.
en.title: Please read and agree to the following code of conduct.
I agree to abide by the above code of conduct
options: yes|I agree to abide by the above code of conduct

en.title: Unfortunately you are not eligible to apply for a CBW award.
en.markdown:
Unfortunately you are not eligible to apply for a CBW award

Your "Applicant Information" indicates that you are not attending a Canadian University, College, Teaching hospital or not-for-profit research institution and/or that you are not a graduate student, post doctoral fellow, or clinical fellow.

en.title: 1. Do you support this applicant in attending the above workshop(s)?
2. If the applicant is accepted into the above workshop(s), will you be covering their registration and travel costs?
3. Will the skills learned by the applicant during the above workshop(s) be taught and shared with others in your workplace/laboratory?
4. What impact would attending the above workshop(s) have on the applicant's career and/or laboratory development?
5. What is the relevance of the above workshop(s) to the applicant's research project? (max. 500 characters):
6. On a scale of 1 to 10 (with 10 being highest), how would you rate the applicant as a student/employee in your group?
You can only apply for one award
en.markdown:
You can only apply for one award

You have already indicated that you are applying for a travel award.

en.title: You can only apply for one award
en.markdown:
You can only apply for one award

You have already indicated that you are applying for a registration award.
All applications require a reference from your supervisor/manager and/or mentor. We will send this reference a form to fill out; preview the reference questionnaire.
en.title: All applications require a reference from your supervisor/manager and/or mentor.
Do you know if an alternative source of funding is available to this applicant? If so, please provide details here:
Please describe how these skills will be taught and shared:
Age
options: yes|I am 16 years of age or older

CBW[workshop_series_title]-[numberid]: Please verify your Email Address

Dear [name_applicant],

Thank you for your recent Workshop Application.

To protect your privacy, your Workshop Application cannot be processed until your email address has been verified, and we need to verify that you submitted an application through this email address.

[events_list_submit]
Verify Email Address »

This link will expire on [callback_token_expire_date], please click the above button or copy and paste the link below into your browser to verify that this is your email address.

[baselink]/forms/verification/#/[callback_token]

If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us at support@bioinformatics.ca.

Thank you for your interest in the Canadian Bioinformatics Workshops.

Sincerely,
Management team at Bioinformatics.ca
support@bioinformatics.ca

approve.title: Your CBW Application has been Approved

body.html:
bioinformatics.ca
CBW[workshop_series_title]-[numberid]: Workshop Application was Approved, Payment is Requested

Dear [name_applicant],

Your Workshop Application was approved.

[currentStateLabelPast] ON: [currentStateDatetime]

CBW[workshop_series_title]-[numberid]

[event_title]

submitted by:

[name_applicant]

[email_applicant]

Please note: If you have applied to other workshops you will receive a separate email for each one as workshops are being processed in chronological order.

Award application:

Unfortunately, you were not selected to receive a Registration Award for this workshop. We received a number of outstanding applications and thank you for your submission.

We are pleased to inform you that you have received a Registration Award.
You are not required to pay for this workshop. The application process is complete!

Unfortunately, you were not selected to receive a Travel Award for this workshop. We received a number of outstanding applications and thank you for your submission.

We are pleased to inform you that you have received a Travel Award.
Please make travel arrangements as given below:

Book your travel. You will be sent a reimbursement form to fill out. You will be reimbursed for your travel expenses according to the following policy:

  1. Airfare/Train (Economy fare only; no insurance, baggage, or change fees; within ON up to $250; within rest of CAN up to $750). Include all receipts and boarding passes.
  2. Accommodations (No incidentals; up to $160+tx per night, 2 nights maximum for 2-day workshop, 3 nights maximum for 3-day workshop and 5 nights maximum for 5-day workshop). Include all receipts.
  3. Meals (Limit - $25.00/day ? No alcohol). Must submit itemized receipts.
  4. Taxis/Parking/Public Transit - Must include all receipts.

Next Steps:

  1. Visit your dashboard and proceed to payment. Your payment is required to complete the Workshop Application Process.
View My Dashboard »

This link will expire on [callback_token_expire_date], please click the above button or copy and paste the link below into your browser to go to your dashboard.

[baselink]/forms/verification/#/[callback_token]

If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us at support@bioinformatics.ca.

Thank you for your interest in the Canadian Bioinformatics Workshops.

Sincerely,
Management team at Bioinformatics.ca
support@bioinformatics.ca

This message is automatically generated by bioinformatics.ca on behalf of the Canadian Bioinformatics Workshops.

reopen.title: Your CBW Application has been Reopened

body.html:
bioinformatics.ca
CBW[workshop_series_title]-[numberid]: Workshop Application Has Been Reopened

Dear [name_applicant],

Workshop Application CBW[workshop_series_title]-[numberid] was reopened.

Next Steps:

  1. You can modify your application and re-submit it for review.

Please visit your dashboard to access your application.

View My Dashboard »

This link will expire on [callback_token_expire_date], please click the above button or copy and paste the link below into your browser to go to your dashboard.

[baselink]/forms/verification/#/[callback_token]

If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us at support@bioinformatics.ca.

Thank you for your interest in the Canadian Bioinformatics Workshops.

Sincerely,
Management team at Bioinformatics.ca
support@bioinformatics.ca

This message is automatically generated by bioinformatics.ca on behalf of the Canadian Bioinformatics Workshops.

bioinformatics.ca Privacy Policy
